unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26 - Automakers are placing increasing emphasis on fuel efficiency amidst rising petrol prices, now hovering around Rs. 110/litre in many cities. A recent study by IIT-Madras highlighted that improving aerodynamics alone can boost fuel economy by up to 15%.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six - Automakers are placing increasing emphasis on fuel efficiency amidst rising petrol prices, now hovering around rupee one hundred and ten per litre in many cities. A recent study by I I T-Madras highlighted that improving aerodynamics alone can boost fuel economy by up to fifteen percent.

unnormalised: Dr. Meera Sharma, a leading automotive researcher, suggests that consumers should also consider factors like tyre pressure and driving habits. "Aggressive acceleration and braking significantly reduce km/litre," she warned.
normalised: Doctor Meera Sharma, a leading automotive researcher, suggests that consumers should also consider factors like tyre pressure and driving habits. "Aggressive acceleration and braking significantly reduce kilometer per litre," she warned.

unnormalised: Beyond engine technology, manufacturers are exploring lighter materials to reduce vehicle weight. Tata Motors, for example, is reportedly investing heavily in aluminum alloys and composite materials, aiming to shed weight without compromising safety.
normalised: Beyond engine technology, manufacturers are exploring lighter materials to reduce vehicle weight. Tata Motors, for example, is reportedly investing heavily in aluminum alloys and composite materials, aiming to shed weight without compromising safety.

unnormalised: Even seemingly small changes, such as optimizing cabin space to reduce unnecessary volume (measured in sq ft), can contribute to overall efficiency. Consumers are encouraged to diligently compare fuel efficiency ratings before making a purchase, helping both their wallets and the environment.
normalised: Even seemingly small changes, such as optimizing cabin space to reduce unnecessary volume (measured in square feet), can contribute to overall efficiency. Consumers are encouraged to diligently compare fuel efficiency ratings before making a purchase, helping both their wallets and the environment.
